cons: A small number of complaints about build quality

customer_reviews.title: GOOD LUCK ON HAVING WARRANTY WORK PERFORMED
customer_reviews.text: Blower worked great for 2 fall seasons. Now it won't start. No problem. It has a 7 year warranty. Wrong! Try finding a service center that will perform warranty work. Even though we live in a mid-seized city (Grand Rapids), there are no service centers that perform warranty work on outdoor Hitachi products within 50 miles. Now I understand how Hitachi can offer a 7 year warranty. It's impossible to utilize.
customer_reviews.author: Jonas

customer_reviews.title: Don't Buy
customer_reviews.text: Gassed this up with a 40:1 mix and ran it about 15 minutes to make sure it worked. It did have a "hot" smell, which I figured was the "new" burning off of it. I was not impressed with the power, but found it adequate. It hasn't started since. Just what I needed, another 2 cycle engine that won't start and in need of repair. I should have paid attention to the other negative reviews that told me this item was not returnable.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: We take very good care of our machines
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in August of 2016, and it did not even last a year. We take very good care of our machines, keep them clean and in a shed, and our local small engine repair shop was unable to fix this lemon. Waste of our money. Did not hold up under even moderate use. Buy a more reputable brand, and make certain that your local repair business is able to service it.
customer_reviews.author: Doc G.

customer_reviews.title: Works great for 4 months DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: This blower started easy and work great. Until today. It died while I was using it. And it will not start. It seems like it overheated, but it will not start after cooling down either. I've checked the fuel line and spark plug. I have followed the correct procedures for starting it. Now I'm trying to locate how to return it under the warranty. Update: Out of three service centers listed on Google, I only found one that is not closed permanently. I called and they said they are backed up because the mechanic has been on vacation for a week. They said to call back in a couple weeks and MAYBE they will have time to work on it.
customer_reviews.author: Shou Hamasaki

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install. It's a bit loud. I wish it has more power but it's ok for household use. Edited: It used to start after second pull but now It became very hard to start no matter what. I got tired and had to use my electric blower now. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: good for 4 years
customer_reviews.text: Once it breaks that's it. hard to find replacement parts. Mine after using it in 4 years the fuel bulb cracked and by simply changing it, then the carburator came next and won't start at all tried changing spark plug but won't start still. WEnt online to find a OEM part for carb but nothing , all available are aftermarket and don't give a best replacement. so I ended buying a new leaf blower to use. This blower is great when it runs, but beware once it breaks...that's it!!!!
customer_reviews.author: MäDmAxX ver.2.0

customer_reviews.title: Buyers Be AWARE!!!!
customer_reviews.text: BUYERS BE AWARE!!!!! I took it out from the box carefully, and followed the instruction diligently. Guess what? The machine would NOT fire at all. The Hitachi repair center was one hour and three minutes away from where i lived. So disappointed!!!!! Now i have a brand new but useless leave blower takes up the space in my garage along with two tons of unleaded gas can!
customer_reviews.author: tonyqian

customer_reviews.title: Happy but for those who aren’t
customer_reviews.text: Great blower...If you are one of the dissatisfied with the unit and need it to operate take it to a Tanaka dealer they are the same unit...Better than it sitting collecting dust than blowing leaves...On year 3 never a problem....ButI drain it and run it dry when not used for off season...But have even used it to blow snow (If powder type)...As I said good unit...
customer_reviews.author: Todd's View

customer_reviews.title: Hitachi is the same as Tanaka
customer_reviews.text: The Hitachi blower I bought was to replace the Tanaka blower I had for around 7 yrs. They are the exact same blower. However, the Hitachi comes with a 7 yr. warranty if used at the home. I like the blower except for one thing that irritates me. I am right handed and often use it in my right hand. The air intake of the blower is on the left side of the blower so if you are wearing relatively loose fitting clothes, it has a tendency to pull your clothing towards the intake. There is a guard keeping the clothing from going into the intake, but your clothing can still block the air flow.
customer_reviews.author: ArkLunatic

customer_reviews.title: I’m a landscaper - great blower!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these on a lightening deal. Wasn’t expecting much because ive always had Redmax or Sthil. I’m a landscaper/private gardener. My blowers get used a lot, bounced around in the bed of my truck, and left out in rain all the time. This blower held up awesome! My first one was just run over on jobsite. I immediately even At double what I paid ordered another one without hesitation. But, I do have a redmax blower for leaves. I also which has probably made a big difference, only uses the Sthil Motomix. If it ever was a lightening deal again I’d probably buy 2 more!
customer_reviews.author: amanda2stl

customer_reviews.title: HItachi customer service was HORRIBLE.
customer_reviews.text: It does work ok, but the hoses all disintegrated quickly. 7 Year warranty is a joke, nothing is covered under it that would actually fail. They offered to have me pay to ship it back for a service estimate, instead I had to spend $30 on replacement hoses and the primer bulb and did the work myself. HItachi customer service was HORRIBLE.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce C. Brown

customer_reviews.title: GREAT blower BUT with noted issues. all in all though if you wanna move air this will do it well
customer_reviews.text: runs super, BUT the intake if you are right handed will suck in your shirt, (a must to be tucked in tight) and if you are left handed the exhaust is on the right side front and gets hot Must keep it fwd. and clear of your self. Tube should be longer and a curved end would be nice.....ALL that said it runs great , starts great , and blows like a hurricane.......... after thought also the trigger is too long you cannot get your fingers off it so you can reposition your hand or slow to ldle, you have to hold it with like your 2 smallest fingers to clear the trigger. kinda hard to do after a while.
customer_reviews.author: G.P.WI

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight & Powerful
customer_reviews.text: Used this for the first time this year after my Black & Decker wouldn’t start. I’m extremely surprised about how light weight and how much power this blower has. I actually liked it without the cone that fits on the end to focus the air pushing out (seen in picture). That said it’s a nice additional feature. Easy to find pre mixed gas to use with it at your local hardware store if you don’t want to mix on your own. I would recommend this to a friend. If this review was helpful please let me know by clicking the “Helpful” button below the review.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Started once and never again
customer_reviews.text: The one theme all Hitachi leaf blowers is they are so extremely difficult to get started. If you are a woman who is not a bodybuilder, do not buy this product! My husband and I were never able to start this particular leaf blower so I am going to return it. Another malfunction with this particular leaf blower brand - the plastic 'pump' used to push gasoline inside the motor corrodes within 2 years and the entire machine must be replaced due to a 0.50 cent part that cannot be replaced/ordered. I would not recommend this blower.
customer_reviews.author: christina Fox

customer_reviews.title: Seven Year Warranty does not cover wearing parts
customer_reviews.text: The blower was actually excellent in all phases until it failed. Seven Year Warranty does not cover wearing parts..I just took my Leaf Blower in for service..It needs a carburetor. I was told it is not covered..Please read the fine print in the warranty..A 7 year warranty is NOT what it appears to be..Everybody at Hitachi was friendly, but unable to help..
customer_reviews.author: Marc Mc

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Hard to start, almost totally impossible without at least 50 priming pumps on the bubble (instruction states 10 to 15. Reliability is anything but assured. 3 usages and parts already fell off , other shut off mechanism has failed. Funny thing is, this is a Hitachi. Had a no name, Chinese model that had kept going and going for ten years untik lt was hoisted away by an unscrupiolous passer by from the mail box area at the end of the driveway. Not highly recommended. Other makes are available for a whole lot less money, and a whole lot more proven performance and reliability
customer_reviews.author: FlyBoy

customer_reviews.title: This is a great leaf blower
customer_reviews.text: This is our second one, same model. We had the first for many years, many more than we ever expected it would last. It died a natural death after many years of faithful duty. Read the reviews all over the place for this make and model. It is a die horse. And for the price, you won’t regret it. I’m a woman and it is not too heavy for me. It’s a good workout, but for the average sized fit woman, not too much to handle.
customer_reviews.author: IVJ

customer_reviews.title: Three years in, working great
customer_reviews.text: We've had this blower for three full years (forth will be summer 2020) and it's worked great so far. Zero maintenance needed, it always starts, and it blows well for its size. I'm not a big leaf blower fan really, but with 2/3 acre of oak/maple/basswood trees we have a lot of leaves to deal with. I use this around the edges and for odd jobs, like blowing out the gutters from the roof. It's always started, isn't picky about fuel, and is easy to handle. If it last another few years without any maintenance I'll be delighted...assume it will need a plus and primer bulb at some point, but no signs of that yet.
customer_reviews.author: Granite City Green Guy

customer_reviews.title: Replaces my Echo PB500T backpack blower!
customer_reviews.text: Gave up on my Echo PB500T backpack blower after 4 years. Kept having to get it adjusted at $50 a pop. Impossible to do the adjustment yourself, need specials screwdrivers to get to the jets. HOPELESS. WILL NEVER BUY an ECHO AGAIN. This Hitachi was only $80 and it's just as powerful as the PB500T as far as I'm concerned. For what I need (a 300 foot driveway and 1 acre lawn) this is more than enough. Picks up leaves, grass, wet or dry en even small branches after a storm. Had it for 3 months now and it starts reliably every single time.
customer_reviews.author: RichardWA

customer_reviews.title: Love at first startup!
customer_reviews.text: Well for many years I have used a corded electric leaf blower. Finally got tired of long extension cords getting tangled, having to maneuver them, plug them in the front and the back of the yard etc. I wanted this gas powered baby because it was powerful and light weight. Just got it yesterday. OMG! This is really powerful, maneuverable, lightweight it makes the job of blowing leaves so much faster and easier. I’m in love. Where have you been all my life?
customer_reviews.author: Moverbob

customer_reviews.title: Powerful but not worth the rating.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: 1.The blower power is good 2. Amazon price Cons: 1. Not easily starting. I used 50-1 TruFuel gasoline and after several cranks (after 10 primes) the blower started. 2. The vibration is very high. 3. Bad design of the switch on the top to stop the blower. Its exactly in reverse direction. 4. If you use the blower for 20 minutes and stop it wont start again till 1hr. I saw the same with my old blower (different brand)
customer_reviews.author: VJ

customer_reviews.title: Best blower on the market
customer_reviews.text: The fan inlet is on the wrong side for right handed users and will cause clothing to impede air flow. Just hold it about 5-6 inches from your body and you are golden. The absolute best blower I have ever had. The one I have is about 5 years old and still going strong. I saw this one on Amazon for $99 and had to snatch it up as a backup before they stop making it. You know, like those sneakers you used to love but they stopped making. The blower is very strong, probably as strong as some backpacks. Get it, no regrets here.
customer_reviews.author: Houseman

customer_reviews.title: Piece of garbage..
customer_reviews.text: Piece of garbage...So pissed. This thing locked up and would not work the second time I tried to use it. ON THE FIRST DAY THAT IT ARRIVED IN THE MAIL. So then I was told it was under warranty from the factory. I registered the piece of garbage..Received an email from "Hitachi" they said that I could take it to an APPROVED service center. The closest center is 65 miles from my house. Save your money. And the giant headache.
customer_reviews.author: TrumpsAjoke

customer_reviews.title: What a great leaf blower!
customer_reviews.text: I owned a high priced Stihl leaf blower for years and thought it was great. However, after several trips to a Stihl dealer for exorbitantly priced repairs, I decided to look for a better value. As others have noted, this relatively inexpensive Hitachi blower is bulletproof and an amazing value. It has the dependability and power of the Stihl at a fraction of the cost. I was so impressed I purchased one for both of my sons. Their experience has been the same as mine - a well-built blower that is totally dependable for a very competitive price!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: More power than my old 18V Ryobi leaf blower
customer_reviews.text: This was my first gas leaf blower. I was using a Ryobi 18V leaf blower before this one. What a night and day difference in terms of power. The Hitachi is at least twice as powerful, even when the Ryobi was plugged into an outlet. If this is your first gas leaf blower, be sure to get the necessary 40:1 or 50:1 two stroke engine oil. It won’t run on just unleaded gas. If you don’t want to mess with mix the two parts yourself, you can buy the premixed engine oil+gas too. It just comes at a premium price wise for the convenience.
customer_reviews.author: Johl

customer_reviews.title: only lasted 2 times
customer_reviews.text: I only used it two times and it seized up! I have had many yard tools (2 and 4 strokes) and I have never had one just die on me like this. I really liked it at first but now I can see why it was only $129.00 I can't send it back and now I'm stuck with it unless they ship me a new one and then I'm sure that one will do the same thing.... I can't recommend this leaf blower at all...
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: 2 year wonder
customer_reviews.text: It lasted 2 years. It was good while it lasted. I take extreme care of my equipment. 2 weeks ago I fired it up and ran well. Following week I started it up and it would hesitate and die. I could only get it to run about 20 seconds before it died. Changed plugs, fresh fuel, new fuel filter, but it didn't help. I'm guessing carb issue now. I guess I'll have to take that apart next. I don't see a spark arrestor. Sometimes that clogs and you burn off the carbon. I guess from what I've been reading the warranty is a joke. I'll see if I can fix it myself.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: One Great Blower! - 😉👍
customer_reviews.text: I have had one of these for about 10 years now. It has always started easily with most times on the second or third pull. I have not had one problem with it either. Where other 2 cycle pieces of equipment I have had to change fuel lines, these look like new. It isn't finicky about the gas it gets either. In the winter time, I use it to blow the snow from the cars and off the sidewalks. I even use it to blow a path for the dogs. I love it so much so, that I recently bought another to keep at my fiancee's house. This is simply a great blower at a great price! Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Buckerou

customer_reviews.title: superb small leaf blower
customer_reviews.text: I love this blower . I was buying a Troybilt 4 stroke at lowes in order to not need oil gas mix until that product appeared with a craftsman label and a much higher price tag. this cost a little more than half as much as the craftsman. I use these on a number of residential properties and buy one every three years or so. I bought a second hitachi to save in the box until needed. I like it that much . great product.
customer_reviews.author: frank a plunkett jr

customer_reviews.title: good for a year until fuel line problems occur
customer_reviews.text: What good is the 7 year warranty if you can't ship it anywhere for repairs as others have noted? After a year of light use and being very pleased with this blower, the clear line from the bulb primer to the fuel tank popped out. I managed to stuff it back in with needle nose pliers and a pointed metal pin, but fuel still leaks from that place in the top of the tank. It's poor engineering that Hitachi didn't take into account that the fuel lines don't last or stay in place. They should have been made of better material. Other than that, the blower blows very well.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful blower but with a very minor safety issue
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm. Lightweight, very easy to start and had very good blowing power. There is a bit of a minor safety issue with it as I nicked my finger on two occasions while pull starting the machine. Also would have been nice to have a lock feature to lock the gas button in place for extended use.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Rampersad

customer_reviews.title: Unit works wonderfully and I will add anything if I find any ...
customer_reviews.text: Product was delivered on same day of order! Product started promptly following directions. Started with engine hot or cold. NOTE THAT OCTANE 89 OR HIGHER is outlined in owners manual. Some customers may have used low octane and had less optimal results. Also, the on off switch stays in the same setting you left it in, my last unit (different brand) would automatically flip back to the on position after killing engine. My second usage I couldn't get the engine to start and noticed I had left in off position (face palm moment) flipped switch to on and it started immediately. Unit works wonderfully and I will add anything if I find any issues after using a few months.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Ray

customer_reviews.title: I wish I would have paid a little more for a better leaf blower
customer_reviews.text: This thing works decently and does the job, but within 6 startups the starter coil broke. No big whoop right? Just change the cord out and good to go right? Nope. The actual starter tension spring broke. Okay fine, let's take it to a Hitachi repair service. There's one about 45 miles away! Let's call them. Nope, they're out of business! Next closest location to get it repaired? TEXAS! AND I HAVE TO SHIP IT TO THEM. I ended up buying an aftermarket starter coil and spring and things work just great now. Chintzy, cheap parts is what causes this. Next time I will pay 40 bucks more for a real brand.
customer_reviews.author: Corbyn S.

customer_reviews.title: The one I wanted
customer_reviews.text: I own both Hitachi and Stihl power equipment and I like both brands. I've been looking to by a leaf blower and decided if I didn't get this Hitachi I would by a Stihl. When the brand new Hitachi dropped to $89.99, it was time to pull the trigger. Upon arrival, I took it out of the box to test it. I use premixed 50:01 fuel. Followed directions for starting. Make sure the start button is in the right position and it fired right up! Read other reviews. For the money, you can't go wrong!
customer_reviews.author: Paul L.

customer_reviews.title: Big Wind in small package
customer_reviews.text: This blower is as strong as most backpack blowers that I have used in the past. Takes a long time to start to get heavy. Good on fuel consumption, well balanced, strong engine. Hitachi has always produced a solid engine. They are hard to wear out. Finding this on sale right under $90 and then physically going to Lowes and see what they had for $60 more and up was laughable. I would put this up against a lot of more expensive blowers
customer_reviews.author: marsha cornett

customer_reviews.title: Great light weight, starts with so little effort. I fixed air intake issue Easily
customer_reviews.text: This is the blower I wanted because of it’s lite weight. Only problem was air intake is on side and my shorts kept getting sucked into the air intake guard (had one like this previously as well). My solution was to order an extra Hitachi 6698381 Guard Net from Amazon for $7, cut pieces of gas line 3/4” long, buy a pack of longer screws, so now shorts, if they do get sucked in some, do nor in any way, slow the blower speed. I mow 6-10 lawns a week so I use a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Steve McIlvain

customer_reviews.title: A Must Have for Yard Work
customer_reviews.text: This is a great blower. Very powerful when you need t. I find it surprisingly lightweight and well-balanced. I'm always concerned that my gas powered tools will start easily and this does not disappoint. It has a real sturdy feel and I expect to get many years of service from it. I always read the critical reviews and noted several complaints about the cord breaking. The cord seems lighter than other tools. I can imagine how someone could possibly break it but I have started it many times and I'm confident with it. Of course, I hedged my bets by additional warranty which I found to be ridiculously inexpensive. So I have no qualms about the durability.
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: one last one year then broken
customer_reviews.text: only used a few times, the design is not smart, the blower outlet is not at the center of unit, when you turn the power on, it make you feel the blower unbalance, you are not just need to hold it upright, also need to maintain it towards front. update on 9/28/2017 it only last one year, primer plastic tube broken, have to look for repair. do not buy it.
customer_reviews.author: honeygo

customer_reviews.title: Hitachi Leaf Blower Review
customer_reviews.text: unfortunately, i bought this blower 7 months ago in November and it's already gone kaput! in that time it sat nearly 3 months during winter... i am 54 years old farmer and this is not my first power blower... I generally purchase echo equipment and thought i would try to save $ 35 this time thinking the Hitachi Name might be a good thing... .. In general, the echo unit usually lasts me for 5 years.. This Hitachi unit has been a great waste of time and money.. overall a great let down... buy a different unit! Echo Rocks!
customer_reviews.author: My Experience

customer_reviews.title: Little thing puts out some AIR
customer_reviews.text: I got this because I had a freebie electric that wasn't very strong (and I moved into a much bigger house/lot). Had actually been using the top of my shop vac which converts for that purpose. But this little sucka doesn't need the cumbersome cord and actually has really decent power. And the nice thing about a throttled machine is that you can vary the windspeed by controlling the trigger pressure. I even used it to blow snow off the walk the other day. Used about a total of 20 hours so I can't speak to longevity, but so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: C. Farr

customer_reviews.title: Easy to start
customer_reviews.text: My 81-year-old father was struggling to start his Husqvarna, getting to where it took too many tries or he would give up. I heard from a friend this Hitachi is easy to start. He was right. It's way easier, usually with just one pull. I didn't like the shorter nozzle, but it works as well or better than a long one, and my rather likes that it's easier to wield. I'd never heard of Hitachi for a leaf blower, but the recommendation was right on. He has two blowers now, but the Hitachi is the only one I ever see him use.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Geez Stephen

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Very powerful! Blows all the leaves in minutes. And yes, I was very excited when I got it. It blew my oak leaves like crazy. But here it is in less than a year the motor went out. I refilled the fuel tank only once with the proper oil and premium gas combo. Now it is junk and not warranty covered as it has no shown manufacture defects inside. All this 7 year warranty is a joke then. Very disappointed. I used it 7 times at most.
customer_reviews.author: never miss a good book

customer_reviews.title: Near professional quality tools for a great price
customer_reviews.text: I got this a couple of days ago..,. Easy to assemble.... Put a bit of gas in it... pulled it twice... it started right up... I let it idle,,, and it still blew enough to clean the patio.... Shut it off real soon... I just wanted to run it a little to break it in.... A few minutes later I started it again... and second pull it started right up.... Guys,,, it seem like a great machine.... I will run in more and let you know UPDATE: I have had this for awhile now... used it again yesterday..... Worked great,, and runs perfectly.. Idles a bit fast... so what.......
customer_reviews.author: ffabric

customer_reviews.title: Does not start, Fuel bulb pump leakage, Trigger switch does not work, etc.
customer_reviews.text: I had unit for 14 months! First issue was pressing the bulb to prime the fuel! There was a leakage between the line and the tank. Okay, I'll live with it. Next, pulling the cord to start the unit. The cord kept getting caught/jammed. Okay, I'll live it, I'll learn to adjust. Finally, the trigger to apply power just stopped working! Unit will come on, but it runs at low power and you can't make any adjustments. I purchased this unit because of price! It was $128. That works out to be approximately $9 a month rental. I'm ordering another unit and it will not be a Hitachi! Poor quality!
customer_reviews.author: joseph milton

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy.
customer_reviews.text: It was good while it lasted. This blower lasted me 10 sessions of use. Then the pull cord broke..... seriously? After 10 times? I had to replace the cord myself. It was extremely difficult to replace. I didn’t want to spend $20 for a replacement. This is a money pit. Bad buy. I can’t even return it because amazon doesn’t allow return of flammable items. I’m so disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy N

customer_reviews.title: High Powered Blower
customer_reviews.text: I like the lightweight and high power of the blower. It is more powerful than the blower it replaced. I have used for several months now and it is a little harder to start than the Poulan that it replaced. I liked the 7 year warranty but reading from other readers that you need a service center to bring the tool into I doubt I will be able to find one close to my location. Good choice in the low priced blower market.
customer_reviews.author: DGTTAMU

customer_reviews.title: 2nd one
customer_reviews.text: SO I bought one of these 3 years ago, I use it maybe 2x a week from March- October in Utah. I had to replace the pul string and then last month it died, it was running hard for a few months, some rattling in the motor, then it cleared and a week or two later it died. I was putting high-quality small engine gas in it... But here I am again buying another one in case something breaks I have back up parts. It blows pretty well, I wish the intake was on the other side as I am right hand dominant.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Gundrum

customer_reviews.title: Nice Product!
customer_reviews.text: Very Easy start, good performance, good price and nice warranty! The suction from the left side kind of sucks up your clothing while you are using. But if you use your left hand or hold it away from your body this isn't an issue. Overall, very reliable and good power for this gas powered 2 stroke. I would suggest the premixed gas and oil products you can find at any hardware store. Ethanol is no good for any engine much less a small two stroke blower like this one.
customer_reviews.author: Jerrod

customer_reviews.title: 2 blowers in less than a year
customer_reviews.text: First one started to leak gasoline right by the feeding tubes after just only 3 mths. Thought I had a defective one (but out of return policy) so ordered a new one. Same story.... definitely something wrong with this model. Won't make the same mistake 3x and will try something different.....
customer_reviews.author: Glen Ferrand

customer_reviews.title: and building interiors like nobodies business
customer_reviews.text: Ready to go.....just twist on the tube and tip and fill it up. Being the first one I've ever owned, I have nothing to compare it too. I can tell you it does the job of blowing off driveways, sidewalks, and building interiors like nobodies business! It even blows the driveway gravel off the concrete pad and back into the gravel part of the drive after a heavy rain. I love it. The only thing I don't care for, nor understand, is the vibration. It rattles your hand....but it's tolerable. When it comes time to replace this one,....I'll buy another one just like it.
customer_reviews.author: T. Francis

customer_reviews.title: Working great since 2016!
customer_reviews.text: We owned an outdoor wedding venue with lots of acreage... and trees! That means lots of leaves. This blower was perfect to get everything blow up quickly. We don't have a lot of time before setup for a wedding so we usually need to get the final cleanup around an hour before it is time for setup. This blower handles the job very well! I bought it in 2016 and used it until today. Still no problems... still working great! I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Dione A. Nancolas

customer_reviews.title: I'm happy with it.
customer_reviews.text: My parents have had one of these for a few years that I have only had to do some minor maintenance on to keep running well (clean carb when they run "stabilized" fuel through it, adjust fuel mix, etc). I liked it so much that I bought one for myself. It doesn't have the grunt of my backpack blower, but it does the job well. I have run this for 6 hours straight and it didn't overheat. I'm happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: D. Rhodes

customer_reviews.title: Pull Cord Pulled Out
customer_reviews.text: We have had this blower for 5 months-it has worked great until today. When we went to start it, pulled the cord, it pulled all the way out. We figured that's ok-there is a warranty-NOPE. The cord is not covered under warranty. We're obligated to purchase the replacement part and figure out how to put the new one in. CRAP.
customer_reviews.author: palj

customer_reviews.title: Blower works well now, but it took some time.
customer_reviews.text: First of all, the customer service was first class. Jack worked with me and finally got the blower to run correctly. Be advised. You must use a mid-grade gas in this machine. At least 89 octane. They finally had to replace my original blower with another, but they kept working on it till the issue was resolved. Not the most powerful blower I've had, but it works well now and does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn A. Kearns

customer_reviews.title: good gas blower...
customer_reviews.text: starts easily and is quite powerful. The trigger is very accurate and can control the air movement easily. I took one star off because it did not come with any kind of comfort strap. After carrying the unit around for over half hour, I start to feel the strain in my arms. Also, it's better to carry the unit on the left side. If you carry it on the right side, the air intake will tend to suck in your garment. So make sure you do not wear loose garments. Overall, I am very satisfied with the amount of air flow generated by the unit.
customer_reviews.author: Ratatouille

customer_reviews.title: Sweeper, not a blower.
customer_reviews.text: For years I heard about gas powered blowers being so wonderful. “The power, flexibility and handling was sooooo much better than electric blowers. “ I guess if you had a crap electric blower? But compared to a Troy Bilt 240 mph blower, the Hitachi at 145 mph is simply inferior. This is a good light yard work sweeper. Mowing grass clippings clean up and gutter cleaning on a roof. If you gotta move through an acre of leaves in the fall and running a cord is not a problem, go electric. You can’t beat the power!
customer_reviews.author: DEAFMOON

customer_reviews.title: Small and lightweight - not as powerful as some, but gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: Have used this several times, and happy with the purchase. As mentioned, the size trades-off some power for easier handling and weight - so just be aware. My only other comment has to do with the intake - it's on the side of the unit (which is designed to be held in the right hand). The problem with that is that if you're wearing loose clothing, it gets sucked-into the intake. This is a common problem with all blowers like this, so again, be aware.
customer_reviews.author: gewf631

customer_reviews.title: Good deal
customer_reviews.text: A good buy. I have an Hitachi weed wacker which has been excellent and this blower is also. Starts easily, is light weight, and moves the leaves quite well. Also a plus is that the engine exhaust is separate from the blower air discharge, so it's cleaner and you don't burn vegetation. In the reviews that I read before buying someone said it was a rebranded Tanaka. Tanaka products are excellent, another reason to buy. I would buy again and recommend. Also a 7 year warranty, I guess they have confidence in their product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Used over a year. Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: This is a good one. I have 6 trees on my 2,500 sqft lawn including 3 massive pain in the ass sweetgum trees. This blower does a pretty good job. Fires right up every time. I use this probably 4 times a week from October to February. I'd recommend that you buy some ear protection along with this.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: warranty honored
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this blower 2.5 years ago and have been well pleased with the ease of starting, power, and light weight. Recently the blower ceased to run. Repair centers are Tanaka (same blower) and are few in my area. The call center recommended I send the blower directly to the factory in Georgia. The repairman called me within 3 days and was very informative about what happened to the blower engine. I was sent a new blower promptly and was well pleased.
customer_reviews.author: KINNEY

customer_reviews.title: Buy this blower!
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t know why I waited too long to go cordless. Glad I did after the electric leaf blower died. Hitachi leaf blower is easy to use, started up with 2 pulls in initial start up. I would highly recommend this blower.
customer_reviews.author: Titegroup

customer_reviews.title: It starts on the second pull just like the manual says it will
customer_reviews.text: It starts on the second pull just like the manual says it will. The rope is much easier to pull than any other 2-cycle engine I've had experience with. It is also much quieter and lighter than other blowers I've used and has plenty of power to clean garage, patio, pile leaves, etc. As other reviewers have said, it does want to suck in your pants leg if you use it right handed but for me that's not a big problem.
customer_reviews.author: Dale D

customer_reviews.title: No good if your right handed
customer_reviews.text: My biggest issue with this blower is my pants, and shirt get sucked in where the fan sucks air in. It's not that heavy. Blowing air out could be better. To improve the air pressure out, I replaced the nozzle end with my other older blower witch is smaller, and now the air comes out with more pressure.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: WOW! THE BEST BLOWER OUT THERE!
customer_reviews.text: Boy & girls, buy this! this is my second one on 8 years! Never fails to start! Not as extreme power as the old Craftsman units from the past, but close! Durable housing, excellent engine. was labeled as a regular machine years ago but as I learned from the last unit, it is professional grade for little $$.......
customer_reviews.author: Felix The CAT

customer_reviews.title: Works Excellent So Far and Love the Looonnngggg Warranty
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together out of the box. Smooth running and not too loud compared to some other gas blowers. Excellent power coming out and easily clears grass/leaves from driveway after cutting the lawn. Also does a great job in blowing fall leaves into a pile, even when they are damp and not completely dry. I got this at $89.00 as The Sale of The Day, but I would definitely pay full price for it. Quality seems much better than some other brands I have had in the past. If you don't want to top the $200+ mark for a Husqvarna or and Echo, then I would definitely suggest this as your best sub $200 gas blower.
customer_reviews.author: WolverinesGoBlue

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic machine
customer_reviews.text: I used my neighbors and really liked it. It performed better than a comparable “orange” model. It’s lightweight and powerful. Removing leafs at my home isn’t just an inconvenience. It’s a 3 day event that is repeated at least twice. I needed at blower that starts every time and is powerful enough to move knee deep piles of leaves. This blower fit both bills. I’d recommend it wholeheartedly!
customer_reviews.author: John R. Herzig

customer_reviews.title: Best blower on the market
customer_reviews.text: Not a single problem in five years. I run trufuel 50:1 mix through it and it starts first pull every time. Love it so much I got one for my car wash. One of my employees put normal gas in it and ran an entire tank of straight gasoline through it, gassed it back up with 2 cycle mix and hasn’t missed a beat. All these people saying it broke down after one season left gas in the tank over winter, no doubt. Buy a $6 can of truefuel every year and you won’t have a single problem.
customer_reviews.author: brandon

customer_reviews.title: Very nice, high powered blower
customer_reviews.text: Really good blower. I am writing this a year after purchasing it and it works very good. Able to blow leaves easily. Wet leaves are different matter, for them you have to get close but that is the issue with all blower. Hitachi quality and warranty. No problem starting, I use 87 octane gas. My driveway and yard looks much cleaner with this in the garage.
customer_reviews.author: Working Dad

customer_reviews.title: As advertised, solid performer
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Two months of use 1-3 times per week. Starts on second pull full choke every time when cold (after priming about 7-10 times). Drop the choke immediately and you're off and running. Running Stihl premix exclusively to see if that helps the long term durability of the carb and lines that others have complained about. Will update review if the experience changes. Great performance for the price point. Only negative is this thing vibrates to beat the bandit so plan on your hands being numb or tingly after only a couple minutes of operation. But again, some trade offs for the price point.
customer_reviews.author: BTCRUZR

customer_reviews.title: Hefty Blow and Starts Reliably Every Time
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this blower. Starts great every time. No starting problems!!! Couple small items I would have changed. You have to hold the engine with one hand while pulling the cord with the other because it's not balanced. The on/off switch is also not spring loaded. So remember to push it on when you start it. The blow is rated at 170 MPH but I can't tell anything different from another brand I had that rated at 200+.
customer_reviews.author: A. E. Hartman

customer_reviews.title: If you are looking to blow things away... look no further.
customer_reviews.text: This thing blows! I've seem things that blow and suck, but this thing blows and does it well. All jokes aside, the Hitachi RB24EAP is a very powerful leaf blower which I have used for my yard in the fall. I have yet to be able to test it on snow as we don't get much around here. It would be nice to be able to decrease or increase the blowing power though. The one thing I wish this would have is the ability to suck the fallen foliage. For locations like bushes or corners, vs trying to forcefully blow them out.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Powerful enough for wet pine needles
customer_reviews.text: Plus side: Lots of power,and light weight. Down side, takes many pulls to start, the hand grip is awkward with a medium work gloved female hand and it would have been better with a more upturned end attachment. Because it is so powerful the focused cone end blows bare spots in our gravel drive., if you have just decking or cement, pine needles or leaves, you're gonna love this. Length of attachment hose is fine, but Im only 5'5".
customer_reviews.author: Beady Gal

customer_reviews.title: This unit was used in last 3 years as a leaf blower in the fall and a blower of light snow falls in the winter so basically for
customer_reviews.text: I owned this unit since August 2013 and I have used it year in year out in a school grounds setting as I am a Building Engineer. This unit was used in last 3 years as a leaf blower in the fall and a blower of light snow falls in the winter so basically for 6 months out of the year and still works great with original spark plug. Great unit just make sure you put stabil in the gas however i still drain out the gas and run the unit dry never a problem always start on second pull just like new. ONE OF THE BEST BUYS I MADE!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mesmerize

customer_reviews.title: Bad Vibrations
customer_reviews.text: I thought is was funny reading the instruction manual and its states multiple times NOT responsible for arm or hand fatigue or injury due to long use. For a quick sweep of the patio it's a good blower. It's an inexpensive blower I should say. $99 I would not recommend this at all if you plan to use for more than 5 minutes at a time. Switch hands every 4-5 seconds or you will start to feel it in your fingers and elbows. The good: it starts right up. very fuel efficient. blows leaves and debris effectively.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great so far!
customer_reviews.text: Great blower so far. Cranks easily, runs well, and is plenty powerful. I mainly use it for blowing leaves off of the lawn and it lifts my fescue turf at full power. Wouldn't want anything stronger I don't believe (for my use). Only negative I can say is that it has a strong plastic melting type oder while running that hasn't gone away yet after several hours of use.
customer_reviews.author: Noj

customer_reviews.title: 3 year review - started leaking
customer_reviews.text: This is a great blower while it lasts. I use this frequently annually from May - October each year for the past 3 years. Last year it started leaking as the fuel tube that goes from the fuel tank to manual pump bubble started to leak. Looking closely, it appears the tube is slightly too short and I could not remedy it using the same tube. I will search for new tubing and try that to see if it works.
customer_reviews.author: wil

customer_reviews.title: Excellent lightweight easy to use leaf blower.
customer_reviews.text: So this is the second leaf blower that I bought. I was super happy with the first one. Unfortunately this one has a problem with the primer bulb. It doesn’t in Flete so I can’t get any flow of gasoline. I didn’t that works great. I’m going to reach out to the company and see if they can replace it. But I would definitely remake recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: JMC

customer_reviews.title: leaks fuel after 2 years
customer_reviews.text: The fuel lines are leaking after a only 2 years. Apparently this is a common problem. It has been impossible to find an authorized service dealer. The company has changed hands in some way and phone numbers either don't work or cut you off when choosing the menu item for service. This seven year warranty is certainly a joke. Could offer 100 years but if you can't get repairs what good is it? DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT
customer_reviews.author: Fergy

customer_reviews.title: Hard restarts
customer_reviews.text: After using it a while if I turn if off for 20 minutes or so it won't start. Even using the choke and pressing the fuel bulb. I simply can't use it. This is the second one I've owned both with this problem but the first began after a few years. This one is only after a year. I have a bad heart and I'll probably have to buy a rechargeable.
customer_reviews.author: S. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Bought one and then bought another!
customer_reviews.text: Bought one and then bought another! This is lightweight and powerful. My wife can start it and she normally hates anything lawn related. It complements the Hitachi weed trimmer quite well. the advantage to having the blower and trimmer from the same is company is that work the same way. I rule mine with premix gas/oil. The premix is expensive but it contains no ethanol. Besides, the amount used is so small the price is not significant. I have no had the weed trimmer for two years and it has been flawless. I have had my first blower for a year and it too has been flawless.
customer_reviews.author: Well Read

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a small gas blower to replace my corded one. I wanted to go with a battery powered unit but just couldn't justify the high cost and short run times. I saw some recommendations for the Hitachi. With the long consumer warranty and reasonable price I decided to give it a try. It's light weight, starts easy,and has plenty of power for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: R. Thornton

customer_reviews.title: Powerful little blower
customer_reviews.text: Pulled this blower out of the box and thought was too small and light weight to have any power. Turns out that it is the strongest hand held blower I've ever used. After three hours of continuous use, blowing leaves out of hedges, vines and dense growth were I'd never been able to before I'm sold on this little wonder.
customer_reviews.author: Merrill

customer_reviews.title: Great, light, easy to use blower
customer_reviews.text: Love this blower... so much easier to use than my previous electric one where I’d have to drag the cord that would snag or tangle. Only disappointment is, if it hasn’t been used for several days, I find it can be hard to start and I have gotten frustrated with that. One I get it started, it will start up again with the first pull. It’s just that first start that is often very difficult to get going
customer_reviews.author: embrace-each-day!

customer_reviews.title: Powerful jet and not as heavy as I expected.
customer_reviews.text: Also, a big plus, this blower starts very quickly. One pull with the choke on and then one pull with the choke off and let sit for about 30 seconds in idle, From that point it works really well. There are also a couple of points where you can attach a strap if you would prefer. I should have bought one a long time ago.
customer_reviews.author: Pughimag

customer_reviews.title: This product blows!
customer_reviews.text: This product lives up to the high ratings. The blower output at full blast is more powerful than my last blower. It starts up easily. The only drawback is that one must continually press the throttle to get it off idle. Not convenient for long blasts. I have attached a strip of velcro on the handle to fix this issue.
customer_reviews.author: boulanger

customer_reviews.title: Better then we expected, and very happy...So Far.
customer_reviews.text: I missed a Great deal, by not ordering when I place this Blower in my shopping cart. The next daty the price went up $30.00. It was the 7 year warranty that caught my eye. Everything in it's class, had only a 2 year warranty. I felt like it was worth a chance...so I took it! SO FAR...I'm very pleased with it's performance. It's only been a few weeks, so we shell see as time passes. My wife uses it, and if she can start it every time....Thats a good thing.
customer_reviews.author: SAK

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a new (I didn't even start it) Husky that paled in comparison, not to mention the Hitachi was 50 dollars cheaper. The Hitachi RB24EAP is easy to do any maintenance on and the power of this unit is excellent. A 7-year engine warranty got my attention. My wife finds it easy to start and operate.
customer_reviews.author: Bud

customer_reviews.title: Nice machine a bit heavy. But it does a nice clean up job!
customer_reviews.text: I had to learn to start this machine. I use the 50:1 gas oil. From home depot or menards or anywhere that its sold. To start after pumping the primer 10 times when cold. I lift the lever just above the choke to start. Yes sometimes its stubborn. But it starts after more that a few tries. It's worth the money, very powerful blower. A bit loud though!
customer_reviews.author: Mae

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tool.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent performance and functionality. Finally a 2-cycle engine where I don't have to carry a screwdriver in my pocket to tweak the carburetor while doing a chore. Easy starts, consistent idle speed, relatively quiet. Blower produces large volume of air at high velocity for moving leaves and twigs. Even at idle there is sufficient volume of air to move debris off hard surfaces. Great at reducing leaf raking time and effort. After using it for a year now, I wish the blower tube was a bit longer. I'm 5'9" and have to lean over slightly. Could be tiresome for someone over six foot.
customer_reviews.author: mrfixit

customer_reviews.title: It was great...while it lasted.
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this little blower. I mainly used in the fall with leaves (quite a bit for this small a blower), but I also used it to clear off the drive way/sidewalk during the spring. Unfortunately, the good times didn’t last. One day I was going to start up and the pull string broke. I feel like it should have lasted much longer than it did ( I’ve had the blower for just over a year). Take your chances if you want, but don’t be surprised if something fails eventually.
customer_reviews.author: VentureTraceOutdoors

customer_reviews.title: this little guys moves a lot for its size
customer_reviews.text: Although this doesn't push as much as a larger back-pack model, this little guys moves a lot for its size. Assuming you have the switch "ON" (my first mistake), and primed, it startes relatively easily. I haven't had any problems with it yet, but, I saw reviews that had some negative information after the first winter. I'll have to add to my reveiw in a few months after the snow stops and the grass turns green again.
customer_reviews.author: D&B ROBB

customer_reviews.title: Good blower, starts easily.
customer_reviews.text: I got this blower on recommendation from a female family member who had one. It is lightweight, and strong. It blows really well, and startup is very easy. I do hear, on occasion, an odd gearing sound, but am hopeful that it is just an anomaly and not anything serious. It seems to be holding up well.
customer_reviews.author: Keoni

customer_reviews.title: It's a throw away unit with a worthless warranty
customer_reviews.text: I love these units until they quit, which will happen before the warranty expires. Unfortunately the warranty is worthless as no dealer in my major City of Phoenix is willing to work on it. It starts to fail when the flywheels loosens up and sounds like it's going to fly apart. Tightening the nut on the fan will work once or twice, then no more. I basically had to toss it, but like I said, I liked the unit well enough because of it's weight to buy another knowing that it's a throw away blower. Also, you will never get the Hitachi help line to answer their phone. If this one fails early it back to Stehl unit.
customer_reviews.author: Elaine Bergquist

customer_reviews.title: Very unsafe to operate it shut off suddenly
customer_reviews.text: I had bought the blower right before fall and used it only for 2.5 months. Then last week when I took it out and was using it do the spring cleaning it shut off all on a sudden twice within 30 mins. of use. Then when I had started again to use it shut off with a flash of fire spark with a burning smell. I will not recommend anyone to buy this blower. I am waiting to report it to consumer report and also to better bureau of business. This is a very unsafe blower to use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazon is Great! got the blower in a day
customer_reviews.text: Amazon is Great! got the blower in a day. The blow pipe assembly instruction said; Conical pipe to straight pipe Fig 2. Align groove (5) on conical pipe (6) projection (4) on straight pipe (1) and rotate the conical pipe in place. This is not possible! The tolerance on the two pieces are to tight and the tubes can not be pushed together and rotated. I call Hitachi and they are aware of this and said that the blower specifications were based on conical tip installed. To bad none of the reviews I read indicated this was an issues.
customer_reviews.author: David Roberts

customer_reviews.title: The best blower we have ever owned.
customer_reviews.text: We live on 5 acres and have owned several of the high end blowers and this by far is the best. Before I purchased it I read all of the reviews and my husband was highly skeptical that this wouldn’t hold up like his last Stihl blower. His skepticism quickly turned to complete amazement the first time he powered it on. We use it everyday for the yard, barn, woods, driveway, and for blowing the excess water off of the vehicles after a good wash and after 3 months of use it still runs just as well as the 1st time. You can’t go wrong with this product.
customer_reviews.author: B Reaves

customer_reviews.title: Quality Leaf Blower!
customer_reviews.text: I have owned many brands of leaf blowers from cheapie Wally World blowers to higher end models. The Hitachi RB24EAP is a great because it just WORKS! Starts on the first or second pull and it just functions great. It does a great job with cleaning out leaves in the rain gutters as well as small gravel from our driveway
customer_reviews.author: Garret Bertrand

customer_reviews.title: Country boy’s take
customer_reviews.text: Love this little guy. Hitatchi makes components for a little startup you may have heard of, Honda motors. Literally started on very first pull and clears our acre free of leaves on a tank n a half of gas. Given the size of the tank and how long I had that joker on full throttle I was genuinely impressed. Some mention warranty being bogus - cross that bridge when I get to it. Bit heavy for my wife to run for too long, but just right for me. Recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Received the Hitachi hand held leaf blower a few days ago. Used today for the first time and I am very pleased with the purchase. Pros: Simple assembly Easy start Trigger throttle control Great top speed air volume Good weight and balance I just threw away a 10 year ago old Craftsman, it served me well, but had I know how much nicer the Hitachi is I would have gotten rid of it years ago. I'm now shopping for a new weed wacker, I will probably buy an Hitachi I have to every confidence this leaf blower will serve me well for many years. It's a really well built machine.
customer_reviews.author: SVF

customer_reviews.title: Quality, reliable, affordable
customer_reviews.text: This blower is amazing! I owned 1 for 3 years until I left my garage door open and it was stolen. While I had it, it never hesitated to start or had any issues at all. Even after sitting for the winter it would start right up. I did use a proper mixture of fuel/oil/stabilizer. I've had the 2nd unit for a year and starts every time. Hopefully I'll be able to keep this one for awhile. It's not exactly cheap, you can get a gas blower for $90. But considering how well it is made and performs, it's actually quite a bargain.
customer_reviews.author: michael wells

product_meta.title: Hitachi RB24EAP Gas Powered Leaf Blower, Handheld, Lightweight, 23.9cc 2 Cycle Engine, Class Leading 441 CFM, 170 MPH, Commercial Grade, 7 Year Warranty
product_meta.description:
The Hitachi RB24EAP Hand Held leaf Blower is one of the lightest (only 8.6lbs) and most powerful (at 441 CFM) blowers in its class. Available to both homeowners and professionals, the RB24EAP is quick and simple to start, and features a low emission Pure Fire II engine and large throttle lever for easy operation. The exceptional balance and lighter weight make it ideal for small cleanup, while it has the performance potential for larger

Built to make quick work of big cleanup tasks, the Hitachi RB24EAP Handheld Blower uses a 23.9 cc commercial-grade engine. It features PureFire low-emission two-stroke engine technology, a large two-finger throttle lever, and an auto-return stop switch. It offers an air volume of 441 cubic feet per minute and delivers air speeds up to 170 miles per hour for effective debris removal.

Industry Leading Warranty

7-Year Consumer Warranty

Efficient, Low-Emission Engine

Whether your cleanup job is big or small, your blower can only perform as well as the engine behind it. This Hitachi leaf blower's 23.9 cc, 1.13-horsepower commercial-grade engine features PureFire low-emission two-stroke technology. Fewer fumes mean safer operation and less environmental impact. This design makes the blower CARB Tier III compliant for use in California.

High Air Volume and Velocity for Quick Debris Movement

The blower produces an air velocity of 170 miles per hour when used with the included taper nozzle. It has an air volume of 441 cubic feet per minute, which means it's suitable for big jobs--such as autumn leaf removal--and quick tasks--such as removing stray grass clippings.

Lightweight Design for User Comfort

Thanks to a lightweight design, this handheld blower is easy to maneuver. It weighs 8.6 pounds for reduced user fatigue, and it features a large two-finger throttle lever for easy operation.

For further convenience, the leaf blower's auto-return stop switch automatically resets to the "on" position to simplify startups.

Warranty Information

This Hitachi handheld blower is backed by a 7-year consumer warranty. When used in non-rental commercial applications, the blower is covered by a two-year warranty. When used in rental applications, it is covered by a one-year warranty.

What's in the Box

Hitachi handheld leaf blower, taper nozzle, owner's manual



AMAZON.COM

It features PureFire low-emission two-stroke engine technology, a large two-finger throttle lever, and an auto-return stop switch. It offers an air volume of 441 cubic feet per minute and delivers air speeds up to 170 miles per hour for effective debris removal.

This design makes the blower CARB Tier III compliant for use in California.High Air Volume and Velocity for Quick Debris Movement
The blower produces an air velocity of 170 miles per hour when used with the included taper nozzle. It has an air volume of 441 cubic feet per minute, which means it's suitable for big jobs--such as autumn leaf removal--and quick tasks--such as removing stray grass clippings.

For further convenience, the blower's auto-return stop switch automatically resets to the "on" position to simplify startups.

Warranty Information
This Hitachi handheld blower is backed by a seven-year consumer warranty. When used in non-rental commercial applications, the blower is covered by a two-year warranty. When used in rental applications, it is covered by a one-year warranty.

What's in the Box
Hitachi handheld blower, taper nozzle, owner's manual
feature_bullets: Class leading air volume at 441 CFM for excellent debris movement
Lightweight (only 8.6 lbs) & well-balanced for comfortable use and less fatigue
23.9 cc Commercial grade 2-stroke engine for outstanding power & longer life
Industry leading warranty- 7-year consumer use, 2-year commercial use, 1-year rental use
Produces an impressive air velocity of 170 MPH (with taper nozzle)
Large two-finger throttle lever for easier operation; Fuel Tank Capacity: 17.6 fl. oz.
Features PureFire low emission 2-stroke engine technology for a better environment
NOTE: Refer User Guide on Technical Specification before use

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars4,462 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
